body.name: RG35XX Plus Retro Video Handheld Game Console 3.5 in IPS Screen Linux OS 64G TF Card with 5500 Classic Games Built-in 3300mAH Battery Compatible with 5G WiFi and Bluetooth 4.2(Black T)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 14. Order within 14 hrs 28 mins
Or fastest Same-Day pickup Today 2 PM - 6 PM. Order within 4 hrs 28 mins
features: Model and Design: The RG35XX Plus handheld gaming console is available in three attractive colors - transparent black, gray, and white. Its design features a 3.5-inch IPS screen with full viewing angles and OCA full lamination, offering a crisp and vibrant display at a resolution of 640x480.

Powerful Processing: Under the hood, this gaming device is powered by a robust H700 quad-core ARM Cortex-A53 CPU with a 1.5GHz frequency, ensuring smooth and responsive performance. Complementing the CPU is a dual-core G31 MP2 GPU, delivering impressive graphics capabilities for an immersive gaming experience.

Memory and Storage: The RG35XX Plus comes equipped with 1GB of LPDDR4 RAM, providing ample memory for running games and applications. It also includes 16GB of internal storage and supports TF/MicroSD cards for expandable storage, allowing you to store a vast library of games and content.

Diverse Game Support: This gaming device runs on the Linux operating system and boasts extensive game compatibility. It supports a wide range of gaming platforms, including PSP, PS1, DC, ARCADE, GBA, GBC, GB, SFC, FC, MAME, MD, GG, PCE, NGPC, SMS, WSC, and more. Users can easily download and play games in various formats, providing a versatile gaming experience.

Connectivity and Additional Features: The RG35XX Plus offers multiple connectivity options, including 2.4/5G WiFi (802.11a/b/g/n/ac) and Bluetooth 4.2, ensuring you can stay connected and engage in online gaming. Other features include high-fidelity speakers, dual card slots for TF card expansion (up to 512GB), a Li-polymer battery with 3300mAh capacity for up to 8 hours of gameplay, and support for 2.4G wireless and wired controllers.
body.description: Model: RG35XX Plus Color: Transparent black/Gray/ WhiteScreen: 3.5-inch IPS full viewing angle, OCA full lamination/ 640*480CPU: H700 quad-core ARM Cortex-A53, 1.5GHz frequencyGPU: dual- core G31 MP2RAM: LPDDR4 1GBMemory: 16GB TF/MicroSDSystem: Linux WIFI/Bluetooth: 2.4/5G WIFI 802.11a/b/g/n/ac,Bluetooth 4.2 Games: Support PSP, PS1, DC, ARCADE, GBA, GBC, GB, SFC, FC, MAME, MD, GG, PCE, NGPC, SMS, WSC and other games in various formats. Support users to download games in relevant formats.Language: Chinese, English, Japanese, Korean, Spanish Speaker: High-fidelity speaker TF card: Dual card slots, support TF card expansion, maximum 512GB Battery: Li-polymer battery 3300mAh, lasting 8 hours Charging: 5V/1.5A, support C2C charger Other function : Support 2.4G wireless and wired controller,.Bluetooth Handle Connection,HDMI output TV,vibration motor.WIFI online pairing, streamingAccessories: USB charging cable, user manual, screen protector

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun and addicting gift
reviews.reviewText: This is a perfect gift for retro lovers. There are multiple, if not hundreds, of old nostalgic games. The battery lasts a long time, and it charges super quick as well! The memory card that comes with it holds 64 GB. That’s wonderful! It’s easy to set up and you can just play as soon as you take it out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars DECIDED TO STOP WORKING
reviews.reviewText: I really want to love this little handheld. I put a little over 20 hours of Pokemon Fire Red on this thing and was an overall great experience. There are some quality control issues that can easily be looked over, for example, the start button sticks and is extremely annoying. I went to grab it today after charging it for a few hours the night prior, and it died almost within 5 minutes of use. After plugging in several USB c cords, they all indicated no charging in progress. I have initiated an Amazon return, but I'll leave it charging overnight to see if I can get anywhere. I'm a little frustrated with the progress I've lost.Edit: it appears there is an issue with the current firmware revision that depletes the battery while in standby. I was able to get the device to work after letting it charge overnight. There still appears to be an issue with WiFi connectivity and longer passwords. I've tried updating the firmware to the latest official Anbernic image, but WiFi and standby battery are still an issue. I have since purchased an RG405V and also have an RG35xxh on the way.Overall, this device is a promising little handheld and meets many of my requirements but standby and WiFi issues can be extremely frustrating. I'd say wait and see what official updates are released by Anbernic. The RG35xx appears to have a ton of third-party support and custom firmware, so I imagine the RG35XX plus should receive some of the same support with time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected
reviews.reviewText: Ready to play out of the box

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Finally, a true emulation device
reviews.reviewText: I have tested a few emulation devices from Amazon and was always left disappointed and quite frankly, lied to. However, this breaks that mold.This is a true emulation device with thousands of old and known video games. However, this is more of the base model when it comes to Anbernic devices so, with this specific model, RG35XX Plus, you will not have all video games pre-loaded. For example, this device has zero N64 games.I’ve tested about 5 games from this device for several hours and this is what I observed. Picture quality is excellent, vibrant; however, I did run into a few stutters. Sound is good for its’ little speaker, but it also has a 3.5mm jack for headphones (which I used and it worked good). Comfort leaves a lot to be desired. It is a small unit and after an hour or so, my fingers and joints were hurting from being in a cramped position. Battery life is really dependent on the games chosen to play. For example, an NES game will play a lot longer than a PS1 game. This device does have a suspend feature (similar to the Steam Deck) where you can instantly pause game. You can also save any game file.Price is a little high (about $86 at time of review) compared to some Social Media sites that also sell the Anbernic devices. Overall, this is a true emulation device and I think it’s worth the price if you enjoy retro gaming. Four out of Five stars only due to the fact I cannot play the device comfortably for long, otherwise, it would be a five star product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is the second one I'm returning each one would work for a day the battery would die and not charge. After a couple of days it turned on and it is stuck at the loading screen... An 85$ paper weight is what I bought.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Little Device!!
reviews.reviewText: I love the selection of games!. I also love the bluetooth and hdmi capability, allowing you to play on any tv via hdmi cord and we paired our PS5 Dualsenses to use!!! Highly recommend.
